item.title: Geolocation on Page Load
item.author: kunal.sumbly@gmail.com (Kunal Sumbly)
item.description: While building Geotinerary, I wanted the map to zoom relatively close to the users location. Surprisingly enough, this was quite hard to find an example of. HTML5 and IPs Traditionally, when a webpage wants your location, we use the native HTML5. While this isn’t a terrible idea and can have much more accurate results, there is another method to find your users location that doesn’t require the use of HTML5 geolocation, the users IP address.
